chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam McCoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
No contact with K&M ATV Sales, D. Seaberg, E. Seaberg or S. Howard directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently being served.

records.addlTxt: Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

Case called @ 2:30 p.m. Defendant Adam  McCoy in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Adam  McCoy in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE has previously entered a plea to Cts 1 - 3. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Statement by DE.  Court orders: Ct 1 - 6 year term of imprisonment - Bifurcated SEH - 3 yrs IC/3 yrs ES - Consecutive to any other sentence currently being served - 233 days CFTS. Ct 2 - 2 year term of imprisonment - Bifurcated SEH - 1 yr IC/1 yr ES - Consecutive to any other sentence currently being served and Ct 1. Ct 3 - 2 year term of imprisonment - Bifurcated SEH - 1 yr IC/1 yr ES - Consecutive to any other sentence currently being served and Cts 1 & 2.  ES Conditions: NC w/ K&M ATV Sales, D. Seaberg, E. Seaberg or S. Howard, Restitution in the amount of $676.62, DNA sample and surcharge, Costs w/ 60 DTP, Costs to be paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings during IC. Defendant is not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Appeal rights given.

Case called @ 2:35 p.m. Defendant Adam McCoy in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Adam McCoy in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1-3 - Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 4 & 5 - DRI.  15TR2257, 15TR2258, 15TR2259 & 15TR2260 - DRI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD. Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi states matter is resolved and requests matter be set for plea due to PSI request.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Case called @ 1:07 p.m. Defendant Adam McCoy in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
